text: This place has a good QC for the taste of their dishes. Pig trotter was tender, soup was delicious.  Unfortunately, this is the second time that I find pig fur, yes, pig hair.  It's just they don't care much lately about the cleaning before cooking.  Too bad.

The best pork leg rice in Singapore! With tender juicy pork leg, and fresh coriander, braised egg and peanuts, braised tofu and white pepper soup make it a perfect match! Never ever try the No.2 super duper hot chilli if you can't bear the spiciness! ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£ðŸ¤£
P/s: But we love the No.2 chilli so much! ðŸ¤£

Good food need reviews! Had kway chap. It's a huge mofo bowl brimming with flavour. The soup has probably a dozen ingredients - incl garlic cloves, white radish and clams. Served with crispy taukee, pork skin, intestine and tender meat. I just about licked the bowl clean.

Heard some reviews on this stall, since nearby, drop in to try the Thai braised pork knuckle rice, it was well braised with peanuts, tau pork, eggs and a bowl of the radish soup,  not so authentic thai, but, a good plate of the braised pork rice for lunch ðŸ˜€

Their pork trotters are packed with flavour and come in a generous portionâ€”just $5.50 for one person, served with rice. Their Thai kway chap is also highly recommended, with meaty chunks of braised pork trotters. We always come here when weâ€™re craving a delicious braised pork dish!
